fields.health_warning: GOVERNMENT WARNING: (1) ACCORDING TO THE SURGEON GENERAL, WOMEN SHOULD NOT DRINK ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES DURING PREGNANCY BECAUSE OF THE RISK OF BIRTH DEFECTS. (2) CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES IMPAIRS YOUR ABILITY TO DRIVE A CAR OR OPERATE MACHINERY, AND MAY CAUSE HEALTH PROBLEMS.
fields.name_and_address: TWENTY-ONE WINE & SPIRITS AFTERMATH WINE & SPIRITS LLC, MIAMI, FL

fieldDetails.reasoning: Large prominent text 'FOREVER SUMMER' appears on the front (and top of back) label; this is the most prominent brand wording.
Back label directly under the brand heading shows 'ROSE WINE'.
Back label contains the alcohol expression 'ALC. 12.5% BY VOL.' near the bottom of the panel.
Back label shows the container size at the bottom as '750ML' (no visible decimal or fractional units).

fieldDetails.value: GOVERNMENT WARNING: (1) ACCORDING TO THE SURGEON GENERAL, WOMEN SHOULD NOT DRINK ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES DURING PREGNANCY BECAUSE OF THE RISK OF BIRTH DEFECTS. (2) CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES IMPAIRS YOUR ABILITY TO DRIVE A CAR OR OPERATE MACHINERY, AND MAY CAUSE HEALTH PROBLEMS.
fieldDetails.reasoning: Full mandated warning block appears on the back label starting with the required 'GOVERNMENT WARNING:' prefix followed by the two numbered statements.

fieldDetails.value: TWENTY-ONE WINE & SPIRITS AFTERMATH WINE & SPIRITS LLC, MIAMI, FL
fieldDetails.reasoning: Small print at the bottom of the back label lists importer/bottler information. Text is somewhat small/blurred; joined the visible lines into a single line per instruction.
The back label shows the qualifying phrase 'IMPORTED BY:' immediately before the importer name/address block.
No specific grape varietal (e.g., 'Grenache', 'Syrah') is visible on the front or back label.
Back label shows 'MEDITERRANEE' with the French appellation statement 'Appellation d'Origine Contrôlée' beneath the 'ROSE WINE' designation.
Back label includes the sulfite declaration 'CONTAINS SULFITES' in the mandatory sulfite statement area.
No separate fanciful name distinct from the prominent brand wording is indicated; 'FOREVER SUMMER' is treated as the brand name.
Back label displays 'PRODUCT OF FRANCE' near the bottom of the panel.
No vintage year (harvest year) is visible on either the front or back label.
No explicit statement about standards of fill is present on the visible label panels.
